author: malcolm
msg: Notably, move the 'filesystem initialisation' functionality from the DAG
abstraction layer (dag.c) into the physical filesystem layer (fs_fs.c),
because it has nothing at all to do with the DAG abstraction (and also
because moving it means that the DAG layer now only depends upon the
physical layer, rather than there being a bidirectional dependency
(get_file_offset): Add a comment noting a (rather unexpected)
consistent with what's done in the rest of this file.
(svn_fs_fs__create_txn): Replace laboured file creation of the
next-ids file with a single (functionally identical) call to
(rep_write_get_baton): Remove APR_CREATE from the flags used to open
the proto-rev file (if the proto-rev file doesn't exist at this point,
we have a serious problem).  Also add a note explaining why an odd
implementation artifact of APR's file-handling functions means that
we have to open the file first, then seek to the end (i.e., why we
can't just open the file with APR_APPEND).
(commit_body): Remove APR_APPEND from the flags used to open the
proto-rev file, since we need to seek to the end anyway, for the
same reasons as above.  Add a (shorter, this time) note mentioning
(write_revision_zero): Create as a new static function by inlining the
external function svn_fs_fs__write_revision_zero() from this file
into the implementation of svn_fs_fs__dag_init_fs() from dag.c.
